ec.app.aspga

Class SchedulingStudyPlanProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • ec.Problem
      • ec.app.aspga.SchedulingStudyPlanProblem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ec.Prototype, ec.Setup, ec.simple.SimpleProblemForm, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SchedulingStudyPlanProblem
extends ec.Problem
implements ec.simple.SimpleProblemForm
    The main evolutionary class. This, is implemented all the evolution logic (The fitness function) to scoring the individuals of the actual population.
    Version:
    Fri Mar 14 03:26 2014
    Author:
    Victor Jatoba
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • calculateFitnessValue

        public float calculateFitnessValue(DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual individual)
        Responsible for to calculate the fitness value of the individual in related of the contraints below.

        Constraints classification:

        FIXED:
        alocateAllSubjects(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        subjectInInappropriatePeriod(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)

        HARD:
        fillPeriodsAvailable(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        hardSubjectInEasyPeriod(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        subjectMoreDificultyNeedMoreTime(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        haveDifferentDayPlans(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)

        SOFT:
        hoursToLeisure(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        notWasteAllTimeInTheSameSubject(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        toStudyGradually(ec.app.aspga.DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual)
        Parameters:
        individual - the curent individual to be calculated.
        Returns:
        float the fitness value.
        See Also:
        DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual

      • toStudyGradually

        public float toStudyGradually(DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual individual)
        Check if the study plan have grow-up learn. To do this, verify the quantity of the medium difficulty subjects exist in the begin of the plan. After verify the hard and finally the easy difficulty subjects.Then placing one percent that depends the quantity it was found.

        Classification: Hard Constraint.
        Parameters:
        individual - the current individual to be verified.
        Returns:
        float the acumulative value.
        See Also:
        SubjectWorkload, DayPlanGene, DayPlanGeneVectorIndividual

      • countEmptyByPeriod

        public int countEmptyByPeriod(char period,
                     java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> periodsEmpty)
        Count the number of 1 exist in the especific period of the dificulty.

        Obs.: 1 signific that exist one period of the day empty. In the other words, this period not contains SubjectWorkloads.
        Parameters:
        period - {MEDIUM, HARD or EASY}
        periodsEmpty - the vector of empty periods.
        Returns:
        the number of empty periods.

      • getAcumulativeValueByDificulty

        public int getAcumulativeValueByDificulty(char periodAvailable,
                                 float dificultyAverage,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<SubjectWorkload> subjectWorkloads)
        Return the acumulativeValue from the period using the table classification below. The subject classification by difficulty: 00 >= n < 20 Easy 20 >= n < 40 Easy/Medium 40 >= n < 60 Medium 60 >= n < 80 Hard/Medium 80 >= n <= 100 Hard The difficulty classification as regard as period of the day. If period of the day is... GOOD: 00 >= n < 20 0 (the acumulative value) 20 >= n < 40 25 40 >= n < 60 50 60 >= n < 80 75 80 >= n <= 100 100 MEDIUM: 00 >= n < 20 25 20 >= n < 40 75 40 >= n < 60 100 60 >= n < 80 75 80 >= n <= 100 25 EASY: 00 >= n < 20 100 20 >= n < 40 75 40 >= n < 60 50 60 >= n < 80 25 80 >= n <= 100 0
        Parameters:
        periodAvailable - if is GOOD, MEDIUM or EASY.
        dificultyAverage - the difficulty average of the all subjects.
        Returns:
        the acumulative value as regard as table classification above.
        See Also:
        Period

      • isFakeMedium

        public java.lang.Boolean isFakeMedium(java.util.ArrayList<SubjectWorkload> subjectWorkloads)
        Search if the period contains subjects that have distinct difficulty. In other words, if exist subjects hard and easy in the same period.
        Parameters:
        subjectWorkloads - the period.
        Returns:
        true if exist.
        false otherwise.

      • getAcumulativeValueByDistinctPlans

        public int getAcumulativeValueByDistinctPlans(int qttRepetitivePeriods,
                                     int totalPeriods)
        The cumulative value is then given by subtracting 100 by the percentage of similarity between the quantity of equal periods and total of the periods not empty. This means that if the plan has repeated 10 times and 100 non-peak periods, the percentage of closeness is 10%, then the cumulative value is 90, which is the subtraction 100 - 10.
        Parameters:
        qttRepetitivePeriods - quantity of equal periods.
        totalPeriods - total of the periods not empty.
        Returns:
        int the acumulative value from this constraint.

      • getAcumulativeValueByWorkload

        public int getAcumulativeValueByWorkload(int workloadSum,
                                char dayPeriodAvailable)
        Get the correct acumulativeValue from a list of subjectWorkloads and the period of the day available.

        Classification table:

        If period of the day is...
        NOTHING:
        n = 0 100 (the acumulative value)
        0 > n < 1 75
        1 >= n < 2 50
        2 >= n < 3 25
        n >= 3 25

        SMALL:
        1 <= n >= 9 0
        7 > n <= 9 25
        6 > n <= 7 75
        4 > n <= 6 100
        3 > n <= 4 75
        1 > n <= 3 25

        BIG:
        0 >= n < 2 0
        2 >= n < 4 25
        4 >= n < 6 50
        6 >= n < 8 75
        8 >= n <= 10 100
        Parameters:
        workloadSum - [description]
        dayPeriodAvailable - [description]
        Returns:
        [description]

      • getAcumulativeValueByMaxHour

        public int getAcumulativeValueByMaxHour(java.util.ArrayList<SubjectWorkload> period)
        Return the acumulative value in relation of the classification below:

        if the difference between max and the second max is:
        0 then: 100 - (0*25) is equals 100.
        1 then: 100 - (1*25) is equals 75.
        and so on..
        Parameters:
        period - the current period to be verified.
        Returns:
        the classification.

        Parameters:
        individual -
        Returns:
        true if the constraint was attended. false otherwise.

      • verifySubjectsSum

        public int verifySubjectsSum(java.util.ArrayList<SubjectWorkload> periodWithSubjects)

        Parameters:
        periodWithSubjects - the subjects of the period of the day.
        Returns:
        100 if the subjects workload don't exceeds six hours. 0 if exceeds.
